trans-unit.source: Wipe managed company app data | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wipe managed company app data | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Learn how you can selectively remove company data from devices remotely.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can selectively remove company data from devices remotely.

trans-unit.source: Wipe managed company app data with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wipe managed company app data with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: When a device is lost or stolen, or if the employee leaves your company, you want to make sure company app data is removed from the device.
trans-unit.target: When a device is lost or stolen, or if the employee leaves your company, you want to make sure company app data is removed from the device.

trans-unit.source: However, you may not want to remove personal data on the device, especially if this is an employee owned device.
trans-unit.target: However, you may not want to remove personal data on the device, especially if this is an employee owned device.

trans-unit.source: To selectively remove company app data, create a wipe request using the steps described in this **Create a wipe request** section in this topic.
trans-unit.target: To selectively remove company app data, create a wipe request using the steps described in this **Create a wipe request** section in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Once the request is completed, the next time the app runs on the device, company data is removed from the app.
trans-unit.target: Once the request is completed, the next time the app runs on the device, company data is removed from the app.

trans-unit.source: Contacts synced directly from the app to the native address book are removed.
trans-unit.target: Contacts synced directly from the app to the native address book are removed.

trans-unit.source: Any contacts synced from the native address book to another external source cannot be wiped.
trans-unit.target: Any contacts synced from the native address book to another external source cannot be wiped.

trans-unit.source: Currently this is applicable only to the Microsoft Outlook app.
trans-unit.target: Currently this is applicable only to the Microsoft Outlook app.

trans-unit.source: Create a wipe request
trans-unit.target: Create a wipe request

trans-unit.source: In the **Intune Mobile application management** blade, choose the **Wipe requests** tile.
trans-unit.target: In the **Intune Mobile application management** blade, choose the **Wipe requests** tile.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of Intune mobile application management blade with Summary tile
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of Intune mobile application management blade with Summary tile

trans-unit.source: Choose **New wipe requests**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **New wipe requests**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the New wipe request blade
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the New wipe request blade

trans-unit.source: In the **New wipe request** blade, choose **User** to open the **User** blade and select the user whose app data you want to wipe.
trans-unit.target: In the **New wipe request** blade, choose **User** to open the **User** blade and select the user whose app data you want to wipe.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Device**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Device**.

trans-unit.source: This opens the **Device** blade that lists all the devices associated with the selected user.
trans-unit.target: This opens the **Device** blade that lists all the devices associated with the selected user.

trans-unit.source: Select the device you want to wipe.
trans-unit.target: Select the device you want to wipe.

trans-unit.source: You are now back in the **New wipe request** blade.
trans-unit.target: You are now back in the **New wipe request** blade.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Ok** to make a wipe request.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Ok** to make a wipe request.

trans-unit.source: The service creates and tracks a separate wipe request for each protected app on the device.
trans-unit.target: The service creates and tracks a separate wipe request for each protected app on the device.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Wipe requests tile
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Wipe requests tile

trans-unit.source: Monitor your wipe requests
trans-unit.target: Monitor your wipe requests

trans-unit.source: The **Intune mobile application management** blade has a summarized report on the **Wipe request** tile.
trans-unit.target: The **Intune mobile application management** blade has a summarized report on the **Wipe request** tile.

trans-unit.source: It displays the overall status and includes the number of pending requests, and failures.
trans-unit.target: It displays the overall status and includes the number of pending requests, and failures.

trans-unit.source: You can get more details by following the steps described below:
trans-unit.target: You can get more details by following the steps described below:

trans-unit.source: In the **Intune mobile application management** blade, choose the **Wipe request** tile to open the **Wipe request** blade.
trans-unit.target: In the **Intune mobile application management** blade, choose the **Wipe request** tile to open the **Wipe request** blade.

trans-unit.source: In the **Wipe request** blade, you can see the list of your requests grouped by users.
trans-unit.target: In the **Wipe request** blade, you can see the list of your requests grouped by users.

trans-unit.source: Since the system creates a wipe request for each protected app running on the device, you might see multiple requests for a user.
trans-unit.target: Since the system creates a wipe request for each protected app running on the device, you might see multiple requests for a user.

trans-unit.source: The status indicates whether a wipe request is still **pending**, **failed**, or **successful**.
trans-unit.target: The status indicates whether a wipe request is still **pending**, **failed**, or **successful**.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Protect app data using mobile app management policies
trans-unit.target: Protect app data using mobile app management policies

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure portal
